data.title: I’m here to track down the bad guys, says Avast’s Ondrej Vlcek

data.text:
Ondrej Vlcek has taken working from home to a new level. The chief executive of Avast has the FTSE 100 cyber-security company’s logo emblazoned on a wall of his house in Prague.

The orange insignia, familiar to many of the 435 million people who have Avast’s antivirus and security software on their phones, laptops and computers, sits above a green sofa and is visible over his shoulder on video calls.

“My kids created this for me. It looks quite high-end, but it’s made of cardboard,” the father of three confesses.
